item.title: Bondi Beach terror attack gunman Naveed Akram appears in court for the first time
item.description: Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram, who is charged with 15 counts of murder, has appeared via video link for the first time in a Sydney court as a senior magistrate extended existing suppression orders in the case.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.title: New tobacco laws proposed by WA government to target stores selling illegal cigarettes, vapes
item.description: Western Australia could soon have some of the nation's toughest illegal tobacco penalties, including fines of up to $21 million and hefty prison terms for possessing commercial quantities of illicit products.

item.title: Senior Liberals deny involvement in draft policy to ban migrants from Gaza
item.description: A leaked copy of the Liberal Party's migration policy prepared before Sussan Ley was ousted included plans to "elevate" the current non-binding Australian values statement.

item.title: NRL opens door for New Zealand and England internationals to play State of Origin
item.description: New South Wales and Queensland can now select players who are New Zealand and England internationals after the NRL confirmed a major change to the State of Origin eligibility rules.

item.title: ACCC accuses Coles of 'planned' campaign to mislead customers
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles is accused of a "planned" campaign to mislead customers over discounts on the first day of a bombshell Federal Court case.

item.title: Maugean skate still faces 'catastrophic' risk from salmon farming, Commonwealth advice says
item.description: Official advice is unequivocal that salmon farming remains the main threat to the endangered Maugean skate. It remains to be seen if the federal environment minister will ask Tasmanian salmon farms to scale back their operations.

item.title: 'Signal sniffers' used in search for missing person Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker
item.description: The FBI is using "sophisticated" technology to try to locate Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker, as the search for the mother of US TV host Savannah Guthrie enters its third week.

item.title: Hospital boss says changes already made at child gender service criticised in review
item.description: Advocates have called for for better regional services after a Cairns children gender clinic was restricted following a scathing report.

item.title: Firearms charges laid amid search for Gus Lamont, SA Police say unrelated to disappearance
item.description: Detectives investigating the case of missing boy Gus Lamont have made an arrest during their renewed search for evidence – but say it does not relate to his disappearance.

item.title: Heat, storms lead to extreme fire forecast across dry Victoria
item.description: Almost half the state is expected to face extreme fire conditions on Tuesday due to a mix of heat, dry fuels and gusty afternoon storms.

item.title: Protester takes to roof of Geraldton fisheries building over WA government's demersal fishing ban
item.description: A Geraldton fisherman locks himself to the roof of a government building — and says he has swallowed the key — in a protest over Cook government restrictions.

item.title: How cheating allegations have rocked the curling teams at the Olympics
item.description: Controversy is swirling in curling at the Winter Olympics after the Canadian team was accused of cheating. Here's a look at the whole controversy and why it matters.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 10
item.description: Find out what is on during Day 10 at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Remote WA communities isolated and roads closed after weekend deluge
item.description: Major roads and remote communities are cut off by floodwaters after a deluge of rain in Western Australia's far north.

item.title: CLP announces Anjan Paudel as Nightcliff by-election candidate, Phil Scott runs as independent
item.description: More candidates for the Nightcliff by-election are announced, with Phil Scott running as an independent and the Country Liberal Party preselecting Anjan Paudel, who has stumbled while answering basic policy questions.

item.title: Aussie Walker finishes outside of medals at Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Australia's Bree Walker missed a spot on the podium but still managed a top-eight placing in the monobob at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Australian women and children with links to ISIS forced to head back to camp in Syria
item.description: A group of Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters are forced to turn around after leaving a camp in Syria to try and begin their journey home to Australia.

item.title: 'Devastated' Australia on the brink of World Cup exit after Sri Lanka's record chase
item.description: Australia is on the cusp of a group stage exit from the T20 World Cup after crashing to an eight-wicket loss against tournament co-hosts Sri Lanka.

item.title: The night snow came to Livigno, turning this surreal valley into an even greater paradise
item.description: Livigno is an Italian outlier in more ways than one. Already known for its special tax status and fairytale quality, the town has had a phenomenal dumping of snow, causing a significant shuffling of events.

item.title: North Korea builds homes for families of soldiers killed fighting in Ukraine
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un unveils new housing development in the country's capital, Pyongyang, to repay the "young martyrs" killed fighting in Ukraine.

item.title: Today in History, February 17: 20 years since The Chaser's War on Everything premiered
item.description: The Chaser's War on Everything didn't start the fire, but the embers from the beloved satirical current affairs show are still warm after two decades.

item.title: Angus Taylor bets on migration politics amid global rightward shift
item.description: If migration is treated primarily as a cultural fault line, rather than an economic system embedded in national growth, the debate will remain loud. The structural reform will remain unfinished.

item.title: Robert Duvall, star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95
item.description: Oscar winner Robert Duvall, known for films such as The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95.

item.title: How to decide what type of car insurance is best for you
item.description: Choosing the right car insurance option can feel daunting, but it's the kind of task that it pays to get right. So, how can you decide which type is most suitable for you?

item.title: Results show high levels of lead contamination in dust around Hobart, as EPA flags further tests
item.description: High levels of lead contamination have been found in dust samples taken from suburban locations close to Nyrstar's Hobart zinc smelter, documents obtained by the ABC show.

item.title: Tradies consider leaving careers over lack of onsite toilets
item.description: Tradies are walking out. Not over ability or aptitude but toilets — in a symbol of the sector's persistent barriers.

item.title: Interest rate hike worries? Here's some good news
item.description: Fresh warnings of further rate rises have been enough to send shivers up the collective spine of new homeowners, but if there's any comfort to be had, it's this: Don't believe a word of the forecasts.

item.title: Anti-slavery commissioner calls for tougher laws amid forced labour concerns for Ansell and Kmart
item.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner calls for tough new laws forcing companies to take slavery in their supply chains seriously, as Ansell and Kmart face scrutiny.

item.title: Carlton's Jacob Weitering suffers rib fracture after AFL State of Origin, but cleared of other injuries
item.description: Carlton star Jacob Weitering has received some good news, with the Blues labelling their injured vice-captain as a "good chance" to feature in opening round.

item.title: News quiz: Year of the Horse traditions, zodiac facts and festive customs across Asia
item.description: How much do you know about the Year of the Horse and unique Lunar New Year traditions in Asian countries? Put your knowledge to the test with these 10 questions and see if you're a true Lunar New Year expert!

item.title: Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board suing Melissa Oates for $934k in damages over Jari Wise's death
item.description: A woman who hit and killed her partner with her car in 2020 is being pursued for almost $1 million in damages by the Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board.

item.title: Irish rugby to investigate racial abuse towards Test debutant Edwin Edogbo
item.description: The Irish Rugby Football Union has said it will launch an investigation after turning comments off a social media post that congratulated the country's newest Test debutant.

item.title: Police likely looking for motive during renewed search for Gus Lamont, retired detective says
item.description: Police are again at remote Oak Park Station searching for evidence related to the disappearance of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont, with a retired police officer saying detectives are likely "looking for a motive".

item.title: Mould, asbestos, collapsed ceilings plague some South Australian schools
item.description: Almost two years after a state government report revealed 35 per cent of all buildings within the Department for Education's portfolio were past their design life, many schools are still plagued with issues including mould, asbestos and rotting windows.

item.title: What we know about the ISIS-linked families in Syria who want to return to Australia
item.description: Australia has made limited progress in clearing a passage for the Australian women and their children, citing safety issues in and around the camps, and security concerns back home.

item.title: Juanella Donovan reflects on People's Choice win at National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards
item.description: Juanella Donovan has taken out the People's Choice category at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards for the second time, emerging as the public favourite from more than 200 entries across the country.

item.title: Ex-footballer shot multiple times in Western Sydney drive-by shooting
item.description: Police have been told Matt Utai, who played for the Tigers and Bulldogs NRL clubs, was shot outside a home on the street by the occupants of an SUV, before they fled the scene.

item.title: Reducing run-off from macadamia farms improves soil but more needed to boost waterways
item.description: A new study backs up the agricultural and environmental benefits of certain macadamia farming practices, but the industry says there is still a long way to go in improving waterway health.

item.title: Illegal fishing vessels threaten Australia's agricultural sector as biosecurity concerns grow
item.description: Australian primary producers say they are concerned about the risk of foreign pests crippling entire industries if overseas fishing boats continue to enter the nation's waters illegally.

item.title: A waterfall gushes at Python Pool in WA's Pilbara region.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bushwalkers soak in near 'once-in-a-lifetime' waterfall after cyclone in WA's Pilbara
item.description: The question of whether there is water in Python Pool is often asked around the pubs and message boards of WA's Pilbara. For the moment, the answer is very much yes.

item.title: Own goal ends Macclesfield's FA Cup fairytale against Brentford
item.description: Non-league English football club Macclesfield's tremendous FA Cup run has come to an end, falling to Premier League side Brentford.

item.title: Pod Save America and why Australians remain obssessed with US politics
item.description: Huge crowds have flocked to live shows for the popular and influential Pod Save America podcast, suggesting Australia's obsession with US politics isn't going away anytime soon.

item.title: Search for abducted Sydney man Chris Baghsarian continues, family living 'a nightmare'
item.description: The family of Sydney man Chris Baghsarian, who was abducted in a case of mistaken identity four days ago, are awaiting "some form of closure or resolution".

item.title: Highly sensitive Australian court data accessed by foreign entity based in India
item.description: Highly sensitive Australian court files have been accessed offshore in breach of the privacy act and Commonwealth contractual obligations, an ABC investigation has revealed, raising concerns of a national security risk.

item.title: Australia leads the world in moguls skiing. This is why
item.description: To the surprise of many, the "beach nation" that is Australia is the best moguls skiing nation on earth. How the team got there is no accident.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Eileen Gu medals despite blizzard, Ilia Malinin breaks his silence — day 10 quick hits
item.description: A Norwegian skier melts down in the Italian cold as the Canadian women's curling team hits back at cheating accusations. Here are the quick hits from day 10 of the Milano Cortina Winter Games.

item.title: Emu raids on Nannup's rubbish tip spark growing concerns for mob's health
item.description: Emus raiding Nannup's rubbish tip are ending up with rotisserie chicken bags and piping stuck around their necks.

item.title: Austrian man faces terror charges over Taylor Swift concert plot
item.description: Austrian prosecutors have filed terrorism-related charges against a 21-year-old man who they say planned to carry out an Islamist militant attack at one of Taylor Swift's 2024 concerts in Vienna.

item.title: Criminal defamation case against Australian writer Murray Hunter withdrawn from Thai court
item.description: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission has dropped a criminal defamation case against Australian writer Murray Hunter.

item.title: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon ends post-Bondi Beach attack protest restrictions on Sydney CBD, eastern suburbs
item.description: The controversial laws grant police the power to refuse authorisation for public protests for up to 90 days after a terrorist incident, restricting demonstrations in certain areas.

item.title: Nurses vote to go on strike at Lyell McEwin Hospital as SA government gives immediate pay rise
item.description: Nurses and midwives at the Lyell McEwin Hospital remain set to walk off the job for 24 hours on Thursday, with the union saying the government's decision to introduce an immediate 4 per cent pay rise still falls short of expectations.

item.title: Highly infectious 'Super-K' flu strain blamed for skyrocketing cases in Queensland
item.description: Increasingly low vaccination rates, more summer indoor gatherings and a new mutation of a highly infectious strain are driving the spike in flu cases, experts say.

item.title: WA's illegal tobacco crackdown comes after less than $89,000 in fines issued last year
item.description: Amid moves to increase penalties for those involved in the illegal tobacco trade, Western Australian authorities are slammed for handing out just $88,100 in fines last year.

item.title: Albanese says Australian government will not help ISIS-linked families leave Syria or return home
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese insists the federal government will not repatriate the Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters who remain in Syria.

item.title: Brain expert recommends learning new skills, taking on new challenges for healthy aging
item.description: A brain health expert says you're never too old to learn new skills, as Queenslanders take on fresh challenges such as Pilates, running, and even a law degree later in life.

item.title: One man dead, two people critically injured in 'random' Sydney stabbing attack
item.description: Police were told on arrival at the scene in Merrylands that a man stabbed multiple people before leaving the area on foot.

item.title: Plains-wanderer recorded for first time on outback Queensland cattle station
item.description: A project with dozens of monitoring sites across the Queensland property confirms the presence of the critically endangered plains-wanderer by analysing bird calls.

item.title: Victorian government offers cash to try to secure Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix at Phillip Island
item.description: The Victorian government offers a financial lifeline to the MotoGP operators in a bid to keep the event on Phillip Island.

item.title: AFL Opening Round concept is 'unbelievably important', Tom Harley says
item.description: AFL chief operating officer Tom Harley insists the league's polarising Opening Round is here to stay, declaring it crucial to the competition's growth in northern markets.

item.title: Death of man whose body was found in Adelaide river not suspicious, police believe
item.description: The death of a 48-year-old man whose body was found in an Adelaide river this morning is not being treated as suspicious, police say.

item.title: Brandan Koschel's antisemitic speech at Sydney March for Australia rally 'abhorrent', says prosecutor
item.description: Brandan Koschel was arrested after he appeared on a stage for an open mic session during the anti-immigration March for Australia event in Sydney's Moore Park.

item.title: Former ACT commissioner Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts accuses public servant of sexual assault
item.description: Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts says she stepped down as the ACT's first Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children and young people commissioner to prioritise her safety after being subjected to sexual harassment and sexual assault by a public servant.

item.title: Tasmanian government forging ahead with Wilkinsons Point sale to JackJumpers' owner despite advice
item.description: The Tasmanian government is pushing ahead with plans to sell 15 hectares of publicly-owned land to the owner of the JackJumpers NBL team despite receiving departmental advice to stop negotiations.

item.title: Louvre tour guides accused of orchestrating $16m ticket fraud ring over a decade
item.description: Foreign tour guides and staff who were paid to remain silent orchestrated a counterfeit ticketing ring that robbed the Louvre of millions over more than a decade, Parisian prosecutors say.

item.title: Suspicious fire at Thornton business
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: CCTV captures man on fire after firebomb attack on Thornton convenience store
item.description: A man engulfed in flames is captured on CCTV after an arson attack at a Hunter Valley business.

item.title: Bushfire threatens properties in central Victoria, with rising heat to be followed by gusty storms
item.description: The fire at Trawool, south of Seymour, broke out near the Goulburn Valley Highway in central Victoria on a day when half the state was facing extreme fire danger.

item.title: Four men again jailed for life for killing Albanian refugee Urim Gjabri in Adelaide
item.description: Four men who faced a retrial over the murder of Albanian refugee Urim Gjabri in Adelaide's north in 2018 are again jailed for life, with the judge saying their crime was motivated by "greed and [a] desire to rob him of the cannabis".

item.title: Western Australia's demersal fishing ban hits hard in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
item.description: People in the coastal tourist town of Kalbarri say they are already suffering the effects of WA's demersal fishing ban, less than two months after it came into force.

item.title: Angus Taylor reveals shadow ministry, elevating Andrew Hastie and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price
item.description: The new Liberal leader announces his shadow ministry, elevating prominent right-faction supporters including West Australian MP Andrew Hastie.

item.title: Police inspect outhouse, water tank in renewed search for Gus Lamont
item.description: SA police said they have inspected an outhouse where cement has recently been laid and a water tank as part of the latest search for Gus Lamont in South Australia's Mid North, with no evidence so far.

item.title: Liam Alexander Hall revealed as man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally
item.description: The man accused of throwing a bomb at Invasion Day protesters in an alleged terrorism act attack in Perth can be named as Liam Alexander Hall.

item.title: Coles downplays meaning of 'Down Down' price tags and advertising in case against ACCC
item.description: Coles downplays what shoppers understood when they saw its "Down Down" price tags, saying "not much", on the second day of a bombshell federal court case.

item.title: Marquee Canterbury recruit Leo Thompson to miss 10 weeks following calf injury
item.description: Canterbury are dealt a hammer blow for their Las Vegas trip and beyond with prop Leo Thompson ruled out for 10 weeks due to a calf injury.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics pleads guilty to burglary charge as trial begins
item.description: Lawyers for one of two men on trial for the 1999 murder of Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics tell the ACT Supreme Court he was just the lookout, and had nothing to do with her death.

item.title: Fire crews battle blaze south of Launceston
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service has downgraded an emergency bushfire warning for an area south of Launceston, with helicopters and ground crews in attendance.

item.title: Kyneton women's football players greenlit to join Central Victorian Football League
item.description: A long-running saga in country women's football is set to close as a central Victorian team that had been left without a competition will now be allowed to play in 2026.

item.title: Mobil Oil Australia to pay $16m fine for misleading claims about fuel sold in Queensland
item.description: The ACCC said Mobil advertised its Mobil Synergy fuel but did not actually supply the product at the time.

item.title: French Polynesia drug haul hits $2.4 billion in a month as third shipment intercepted
item.description: French authorities seized a 2.4-tonne drug shipment near French Polynesia during a joint operation with the United States.

item.title: Iran launches military drill as US deploys aircraft carrier on eve of nuclear talks
item.description: Representatives from the two nations are set to meet in Geneva on Tuesday, local time, as US President Donald Trump tries to curb Tehran's nuclear program.

item.title: Internal review finds almost half of all Queensland Health doctors at risk of burnout
item.description: More than 2,000 doctors responded to the Medical Workforce Wellbeing Survey last year, which polled the wellbeing of medical clinicians state-wide.

item.title: Australian production company Matchbox Pictures to be closed by Universal International Studios
item.description: Matchbox Pictures, the local production house behind Dog Park, The Survivors and Secret City, will be closed by its international parent company, Universal International Studios.

item.title: Addin Fonua-Blake and Briton Nikora embrace chance to play State of Origin following eligibility changes
item.description: Cronulla duo Briton Nikora and Addin Fonua-Blake have both praised the rule changes that will give the pair a chance at State of Origin football they thought had long passed them by.

item.title: Private health premiums to rise at fastest rate in almost a decade
item.description: Private health insurance premiums will rise at their fastest rate in almost a decade, after the federal government approved a 4.41 per cent average increase from April.

item.title: Jury shown footage of alleged attack on Strathmerton postmaster John Burke
item.description: A jury in the trial of Troy Maskell, accused of the manslaughter death of 73-year-old John Burke, has watched CCTV footage of the alleged incident.

item.title: Police drop charges against WIM Resource employee accused of falsifying documents
item.description: Victoria Police has dropped all charges against WIM Resource employee Murray Wilson, who worked on the controversial Avonbank Mineral Sands Project.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mother of former Manly player Keith Titmuss breaks silence on lawsuit against NRL club
item.description: The mother of Manly player Keith Titmuss, who died of exertional heat stroke following a 2020 Sea Eagles training session, breaks her silence on her family's multi-million-dollar lawsuit against the NRL club.

item.title: Man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally named
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Man arrested after fatal Merrylands stabbing escaped care 10 days before attack, health authorities say
item.description: A man arrested after a fatal stabbing in Merrylands escaped from mental health care while being transferred between hospitals more than a week ago, health authorities say.

item.title: Father whose son died in house fire accuses lawyer at coronial inquiry of 'degrading him'
item.description: The father, in an emotional outburst, told the inquest he had spent thousands of dollars on psychiatric and hypnotherapy appointments so he could move on from the tragedy.

item.title: Sydney’s great fatberg hiding in the sewers
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ABC to move Adelaide office to new Tapangka site in CBD, alongside arts organisations
item.description: The ABC has announced a new location for its Adelaide operations, moving to a new arts and media hub alongside other government arts organisation in the CBD.

item.title: Grammy-winning songwriter and hitmaker Billy Steinberg dies aged 75
item.description: Award-winning US songwriter Billy Steinberg, who wrote several top hit songs including Madonna's Like a Virgin, died on Monday aged 75, according to media reports.

item.title: Jail term increased for Roma man who stabbed police officer during call-out
item.description: A man who stabbed a police officer with a pair of scissors during a domestic violence call-out in regional Queensland has had his jail sentence increased.

item.title: Aussie teen forced to wait for Olympic final as heavy snow wreaks havoc
item.description: Australia's Ally Hickman has to wait another day for the women's snowboard slopestyle final, as a snowstorm hits Livigno and causes scheduling delays.

item.title: NSW man kept in custody for safety after allegedly 'squandering' $270k of drug-trade money
item.description: Peter John Howlett, who allegedly used a fishing trawler to import illicit drugs into Australia, is refused bail by Mackay magistrate concerned for his safety.

item.title: Jesse Jackson, civil rights leader and US presidential hopeful, dead at 84
item.description: The two-time Democratic presidential hopeful remembered for powerful speeches died peacefully surrounded by loved ones, his family said.

item.title: ASIC announces review into 'lead generators' pushing superannuation switching
item.description: ASIC is investigating whether lead generators are complying with their legal obligations when suggesting people switch their retirement savings into less-regulated investment schemes.

item.title: Australia knocked out of T20 World Cup with one game left to play
item.description: Australia can no longer catch up with Zimbabwe after it was awarded a point from a rained out match with Ireland.

item.title: US military says 11 men killed in strikes on alleged drug smuggling boats
item.description: The strikes are the latest from the US on boats in the eastern Pacific Ocean and Caribbean Sea targeting what Donald Trump alleges are drug trafficking operations.

item.title: Travel quiz, February 18: Which Australian airport has the most runways?
item.description: The Scottish festival Hogmanay celebrates which event? And where is halo-halo from?

item.title: Richard Roxburgh, Damon Herriman and Toby Schmitz star in 'wickedly funny' play Art
item.description: In the 1994 French play Art, Serge spends 160,000 euros on an all-white painting, horrifying his friend Marc. It might just wreck their decades-long friendship.

item.title: Tasmanian salmon industry subject to stricter mortality reporting rules
item.description: Biosecurity Tasmania has introduced stricter requirements for Tasmania's salmon companies reporting on farmed fish deaths — but whether the public finds out is another matter.

item.title: Millionaire Gary Stevenson's dire warning for Australian property market losing the 'fair go'
item.description: British economist Gary Stevenson is on a speaking tour, warning Australia will follow the path of the UK with "poverty exploding" unless politicians deal with inequality.

item.title: HungryPanda riders say Chinese police intimidating families in China over Sydney protests
item.description: Riders embroiled in a dispute over pay and conditions with food delivery company HungryPanda in Sydney say Chinese police have asserted pressure back home to stop them protesting.

item.title: Private health insurance customers stung by exclusions after downgrading from gold policies
item.description: Australians are increasingly downgrading their health cover, with 360,000 people leaving gold policies since 2020. But some have been left out of pocket for surgeries they thought they were covered for.

item.title: Aerials delay is not unusual, as snow causes chaos at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Delays are nothing new in skiing events, with weather and light a constant battle for event organisers. However, the Australian aerials team has an unusual method to handle the disruption.

item.title: Investor's bet on empty building and passionate self-starters transform Charleville CBD
item.description: A few years ago, Charleville's main street had lost its spark, with storefronts empty and windows shuttered. So, what does it take to bring a main street back to life?

item.title: Long-term solution to repeated Waterfall Way landslips on the horizon
item.description: The NSW government hopes to reopen a key east-west transport route by April, as a long-term solution to frequent landslips in the area is explored.

item.title: Australia 'must allow' families with ISIS links to return home from Syria, legal experts say
item.description: Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters should be returned to Australia to prevent harm and potential radicalisation of innocent children, according to United Nations special rapporteur Ben Saul.

item.title: Man who escaped health care facility charged with murder over Merrylands stabbing
item.description: A 25-year-old man police say stabbed a man to death in Merrylands days after fleeing from health authorities has been charged with murder.

item.title: Police to return to Oak Park 'frequently' in search for Gus Lamont
item.description: SA's Police Commissioner says officers will be returning to Oak Park station frequently in the coming months as they continue their investigation into the disappearance of Gus Lamont.

item.title: Hindmarsh Island bridge dispute told through Ngarrindjeri women's art
item.description: In the 1990s, a group of Indigenous women were accused of fabricating claims of sacred sites to stop the construction of a bridge south of Adelaide. It was a decision that has impacted a community for decades.

item.title: Disenfranchised Farrer voters turn out in droves to consider One Nation
item.description: This southern New South Wales town of Gerogery is typically dead on a Monday night, but that all changed when One Nation came to town.

item.title: Bruce Highway cut by flooding at Proserpine as coast cops more than 300mm of rain in 24 hours
item.description: Parts of the Queensland coast have received more than 300 millimetres of rain in 24 hours, leading to road closures, including the Bruce Highway at Proserpine.

item.title: Living across the river from Nyrstar zinc smelter has Jan doing what she can to lower lead risk
item.description: Jan Twomey bought a house on Hobart's eastern shore just over a year ago, knowing full well it was across from a zinc smelter. But news of high levels of lead detected in dust samples has her concerned.

item.title: Police find bodies of man and woman in Rockhampton home
item.description: Police are investigating after finding two bodies during a welfare check in Rockhampton.

item.title: OCD is often misunderstood. Elena wants you to know what it feels like
item.description: Elena wants people with OCD to know they're not alone. But how well do Australians understand the condition?

item.title: Matildas expected to name Mary Fowler in Asian Cup squad, injured Charli Grant set to miss out
item.description: Mary Fowler is expected to be named in Australia's Women's Asian Cup squad on Thursday despite having played limited minutes in her return from an ACL injury.

item.title: Telstra accused of environmental breaches in culturally-significant area in SA national park
item.description: Sources say the actions will likely affect Aboriginal communities and that the investigation was not shared with the public.

item.title: Trawool bushfire threat eases but authorities say blaze not yet under control
item.description: Authorities say weather conditions have helped fire crews battling a blaze that threatened homes near Trawool, south of Seymour.

item.title: Test results show high levels of lead dust around Hobart
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Space industry firm Terram Astra launches with plans for outback Northern Territory, South Australia
item.description: A new company sets its sights on the Australian outback, with bold ambitions of creating a high-tech hub capable of communicating with outer space.

item.title: Posting online, fighting offline: The escalation of Melbourne's violent youth gangs
item.description: Ater "Elia" Good was gunned down last month and police allege it was a gang-related killing. But his parents say their son was not a gang member.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Jürgen Klopp makes Milano Cortina Games cameo, ice hockey fight ban labelled a 'joke' — quick hits from day 11
item.description: Football manager Jürgen Klopp makes an appearance at the Milano Cortina Games, while French ice hockey players are unhappy about the ban handed to a teammate for fighting. Here are the quick hits from day 11.

item.title: Riverland wine grape growers want to rezone land for housing to exit industry
item.description: The wine grape industry in South Australia's Riverland continues to face unprecedented levels of uncertainty, as growers look to exit the industry and turn their land into residential housing.

item.title: Health insurers surge ahead of premium hike, ASX rises — as it happened
item.description: Shares of health insurers have surged ahead of premium hikes while the ASX has started its day higher, and NAB has reported a 30 per cent jump in quarterly profit.

item.title: Parkes Shire Council formally opposes controversial waste incinerator
item.description: The Parkes Shire Council has formally objected to controversial plans to dispose of some of Sydney's red-bin rubbish on the edge of its biggest town.

item.title: Eungella residents want an alternative exit after Cyclone Koji cuts the range road again
item.description: The remote mountain community of Eungella was cut off for the second time in three years after Cyclone Koji brought debris down on the range road. After years of inaction, the community want more options when severe weather strikes again.

item.title: Daly River flood evacuees threatened with edged weapon in incident outside Darwin evacuation centre
item.description: As Daly River flood evacuees near their second full week in Darwin, residents staying at the showgrounds say they feel scared after a group was threatened with an edged weapon on Monday morning.

item.title: Iran announces temporary closure of Strait of Hormuz during US nuclear talks
item.description: Iran says it temporarily closed the Strait of Hormuz — a vital international shipping route — as it entered a new round of talks with the US over its nuclear capabilities.

item.title: Federal Court finds factional and 'oppressive' control in South West Aboriginal Medical Service
item.description: A federal court judge has found that two board members factionally controlled a South West Indigenous Medical Service and unfairly expelled members to avoid scrutiny and maintain control.

item.title: Sydney Writers' Festival announces Randa Abdel-Fattah for 2026 program
item.description: Sydney Writers' Festival has defended featuring Randa Abdel-Fattah on its 2026 program, saying it is "not in the business of cancelling or censoring writers".

item.title: Pauline Hanson issues partial apology for suggesting there are no 'good' Muslims
item.description: The One Nation leader qualified her earlier remarks, which had been met with condemnation, while reiterating calls for tougher vetting processes for Muslim migrants.

item.title: One man dead, another in serious condition after Bruce Highway crash
item.description: Emergency services were called to the crash in Burpengary just after 10:30pm on Tuesday, where police said multiple vehicles were spotted travelling southbound in the northbound lanes.

item.title: Actor Shia LaBeouf arrested for allegedly hitting two men at Mardi Gras in New Orleans
item.description: The actor allegedly hit a man multiple times with closed fists and allegedly punched another man in the nose.

item.title: Rising land prices the main factor blocking new housing, report finds
item.description: A Housing Industry Association report says rising land prices are blocking the construction of new homes.

item.title: Matt Wright moved to Darwin Correctional Centre's Complex Behavioural Unit
item.description: Matt Wright, the star of Netflix's Outback Wrangler, has been separated from the general prison population at the Darwin Correctional Centre where most inmates contend with overcrowding and extreme heat.

item.title: Foo Fighters announce 2026 Australian stadium tour
item.description: American rock superstars Foo Fighters will return to Australia for a run of stadium shows before the year is out.

item.title: Real Madrid star Vinícius Júnior says Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni racially abused him in Champions League match
item.description: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accuses an opponent of racially abusing him during a Champions League game against Benfica, leading to the game being halted for nearly 10 minutes.

item.title: Australia's most successful Winter Olympics coach Peter McNiel and how his moguls team led the Milano Cortina gold rush
item.description: With a background in mathematics and an enviable attention to detail, it would be tempting to think of Australian ski coach Peter McNiel as moguls' answer to Moneyball. The truth is far more detailed.

item.title: Police release man arrested over Galiwin'ku stabbing death without charge
item.description: Police say a 19-year-old man arrested over the stabbing death of another man, 27, on Elcho Island on Saturday has been released without charge "pending further investigations".

item.title: Police charge man and woman with cocaine and cannabis offences at Airlie Beach
item.description: Two people have been charged after police allegedly found drugs, utensils and cash at an Airlie Beach property.

item.title: Housing to play part in future of both old and new ABC sites in Adelaide
item.description: The ABC's managing director says its current Adelaide bureau could be redeveloped in a similar way to an apartment building nearby, while the premier says affordable apartments will still be included on the new CBD site.

item.title: Data reveals 'real wages' position of workers as wage price index lags inflation
item.description: Wage rises are not keeping up with inflation, meaning household budgets are being increasingly squeezed with inflation outpacing wages growth.

item.title: Qld Police seize $100,000 worth of illicit drugs at Airlie Beach
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: As Donald Trump's first Board of Peace meeting approaches, Indonesians are watching their own president closely
item.description: Ahead of the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump's Board of Peace, charged with leading the way forward in Gaza, Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto faces perhaps his most significant foreign policy test yet.

item.title: Is it ever a good idea to stay together for the kids?
item.description: When a relationships breaks down, sometimes we think staying in the familiar discomfort is less scary — and even protective — for our kids. But is it ever a good idea to stay in an unhappy relationship for the sake of the children?

item.title: Equal time rule leads CBS to pull Stephen Colbert's James Talarico interview
item.description: The Late Show host's on-air revelation that network executives refused to let him interview a Democratic Senate candidate puts a spotlight on how US media outlets treat political coverage.

item.title: Legends slam Australia's 'not surprising' T20 World Cup crash out
item.description: For the first time since 2009, Australia won't advance from the group stage of a cricket World Cup and some of the game's greatest ever players are demanding answers.

item.title: Launceston Council scraps 4-day work week plan after backlash from business sector
item.description: A Tasmanian council's move to introduce a four-day work week, in part to attract and retain staff, has been abandoned after pushback by a business lobby group and what has been described as "unacceptable hostility" towards staff on social media.

item.title: James Slipper set to play 200th Super Rugby match as ACT Brumbies travel to face Crusaders in Christchurch
item.description: James Slipper will become the first Australian player to reach the 200-game milestone in Super Rugby.

item.title: Potential rugby development in Sydney's Hills district sparks stoush with protesters
item.description: Protesters say they will block the council from developing sporting fields for the use of an elite club rugby at a reserve in the city's north-west, as a court challenge to the project is due to be heard.

item.title: Chalmers suggests ex-RBA governor's spending critique is due to personal vendetta
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Philip Lowe was critical of the government over spending because it did not re-appoint him as RBA governor.

item.title: Rescuers reach six skiers trapped in California avalanche, nine more missing
item.description: Rescue crews battle blizzard conditions to reach back-country skiers who survived the avalanche but were left trapped by its snow and ice.

item.title: Mazda, Nissan, Hyundai and Subaru face multi-million-dollar penalties under NVES
item.description: Major car brands are staring down the barrel of multi-million-dollar penalties for exceeding their emissions, the first results of the federal government's climate laws for new vehicles have revealed.

item.title: Glove found near Nancy Guthrie's home fails to produce DNA match
item.description: The glove resembled a pair worn by an armed man in a ski mask seen in video footage shortly before she was abducted.

item.title: Planned nurse strike rescheduled at Lyell McEwin Hospital amid pay dispute
item.description: The South Australian government says plans from Lyell McEwin Hospital nurses to strike tomorrow have been postponed, amid an unresolved industrial dispute over pay and conditions.

item.title: Brandan Koschel jailed over antisemitic speech at Sydney Australia Day protest
item.description: Brandan Koschel is jailed after pleading guilty to inciting hatred on the grounds of race during an Australia Day protest in Sydney.

item.title: Jesse Jackson helped lay the groundwork for Barack Obama and kept the fight for justice in the public eye
item.description: Reverend Jesse Jackson, who died on Tuesday aged 84, leaves behind a towering legacy in politics and the fight for justice in the United States and abroad.

item.title: 'Thunderous applause' as vicarious liability laws pass Victoria's upper house
item.description: A bill reversing a High Court decision that found the Catholic Church could not be sued for the actions of a priest passes unopposed through Victoria's upper house.

item.title: Workers in cherry picker help police catch man accused of lewd acts in Goulburn
item.description: A man is accused of intimidation and carrying out a sexual act over incidents at a medical reception and childcare centre.

item.title: Alcoa hit with record fine for illegally clearing WA jarrah forests for bauxite mine
item.description: US mining giant Alcoa is forced to pay $55 million after unlawfully clearing parts of a Western Australian native forest to mine bauxite.

item.title: Former Coles manager admits 'human error' over Shapes 'Down Down' pricing in federal court showdown
item.description: A former Coles manager has given evidence in the federal court on day three of a bombshell case between the consumer watchdog and supermarket giant.

item.title: Man blamed dog for baby's death at Queensland caravan park, court told
item.description: The man became frustrated with five-week-old's crying, violently shook him and threw him onto a couch, the court heard.

item.title: Footage shows gunman spraying bullets into suburban home
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police treating spate of Western Sydney shootings and arson attacks as linked
item.description: Raptor Squad detectives are treating three separate incidents as linked to a conflict between two organised criminal networks.

item.title: Australian citizen with ISIS links in Syria hit with exclusion order, federal government says
item.description: The federal government has temporarily banned an Australian citizen linked to ISIS fighters from returning home from Syria.

item.title: Solutions to stop people being radicalised raised at NSW inquiry into right-wing extremism
item.description: Prevention methods to tackle radicalisation are being discussed by experts at a New South Wales inquiry into measures to combat right-wing extremism.

item.title: Claims of 'racist' comment in WA parliament after Chinese New Year event
item.description: WA Labor MPs call on a Nationals member to apologise for what they say was a racist comment directed at one of their colleagues.

item.title: Mechanic rescued after going missing in Queensland outback for almost a week
item.description: A man in his 40s has been rescued after going missing in outback Queensland for almost a week.

item.title: Sovereign citizen convicted of stalking, intimidating NSW police officer
item.description: A man who a court heard fell victim to an "explosion" of extremist views and misinformation has been convicted of stalking and intimidating a Hunter Valley police officer.

item.title: Victoria loses Australian MotoGP with 2026 race to be last in state
item.description: Victoria loses the rights to host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix, ending a three-decade association with the event.

item.title: Ex-Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila fined $11k over A-League card fixing saga
item.description: Former Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila avoids jail time over his involvement in a card fixing scandal.

item.title: Navy chief's speech disrupted, bomb squad called after rocks thrown through glass door at Canberra hotel
item.description: Officers are looking for two men who fled on bikes after rocks smashed a glass door, halting a defence industry event in Canberra.

item.title: Navy chief's speech disrupted at Defence industry conference after rocks thrown through window
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Overnight rain at Kilto Station.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Blue Bush Floodway enjoyed by all.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Heavy rainfall in WA's Kimberley sees students go to extra lengths to get to school
item.description: Heavy rainfall in WA's far north has led to some students having to make alternative arrangements to get to school, including using a helicopter.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 12
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Queensland man accused of offering $730 to adopt and abuse overseas children
item.description: A Queensland man accused of offering to pay more than $700 to adopt children overseas so he could have sex with them is refused bail.

item.title: Human remains found during $13.3m construction project in Echuca
item.description: An investigation is underway after bones were found during construction works for a $13.3-million project at Echuca.

item.title: Ex-cop granted bail over alleged stalking following neighbour dispute
item.description: A former Queensland police officer accused of allegedly wearing a balaclava and Easter bonnet to harass and intimidate a neighbouring family has been granted bail.

item.title: Man fined $30,000 for poaching rare snakes from Far North Queensland rainforest
item.description: The court heard Clinton Spiteri was with two others when he visited a rainforest in the Cape York area to steal eight snakes.

item.title: Two Doubleview house fires cause headaches for firefighters
item.description: Emergency services extinguish two separate house fires in close proximity to each other in Doubleview in Perth's north.

item.title: A missing man rescued in outback Queensland
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Live: Frightening scenes as Aussie teenager Hickman crashes in slopestyle final
item.description: Ally Hickman's slopestyle final is halted by a frightening crash that leaves her motionless on the course as Danielle Scott delivers Australia its sixth medal of the Winter Olympics. Follow live.

item.title: Firefighters had to work quickly to bring two house fires in Doubleview under control.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Should the ISIS brides be allowed to return to Australia?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Police arrest almost 60 people over unrest in NT community of Wadeye
item.description: Northern Territory police have arrested 58 people in relation to weeks of unrest in the remote Top End community, which has seen brawls involving up to a few hundred of people — some of them armed — spilling out onto the streets.

item.title: South Australia could host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix from 2027
item.description: An announcement on the future of the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix is expected as soon as tomorrow amid widespread speculation the event is set to shift to South Australia.

item.title: Terrorism comes to Invasion Day rally in Perth
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Sisonke Msimang picked up what police said was an explosive device at Perth Invasion Day rally, gave it to them and waited for a slow response
item.description: When Sisonke picked up a device that looked like a glass jar in Perth on Australia Day, she had a sense of foreboding so she took it to police. She says they took some time to act.

item.title: Driver charged over Camden fatal crash escaped Cumberland Hospital mental health care before incident
item.description: A driver charged over a double-fatal crash used a staff pass to escape hospital the day before an alleged Sydney stabber fled the same mental health facility.

item.title: Tackling 'blatant' fake discounting, restoring consumer trust among ACCC's priorities for 2026
item.description: ACCC chair Gina Cass-Gottlieb outlines the consumer watchdog's priorities for 2026, including targeting "blatant" fake discounting.

item.title: Danielle Scott wins silver medal in women's aerials event at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Danielle Scott ends a 12-year drought for Australia by winning the silver medal in the women's aerials final at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.
